The spirit said to the church of Laodicia. I knowe thy workes that thou art neither colde nor hot▪ I would thou were colde or hot.
Apo. 3. 15. Therefore because thou art luke warme, and neither cold nor hot: it will come to passe that I wil cast thee out of my mouth. God liketh only such as be zealous, & addict themselues to his Religion, and feare, and seruice. Euen as an horse being very sightly and faire, is nothing worth, except he hath a pace: euen so he that is of no Religion or
doth halt in Religion or conuersatiō, can not stand in Gods sight.

The Spirit spake vnto the Churche of Pergamus, I knowe thy workes, and where
Apo. 2. 13. thou dwellest, euen where Sathans throne is. And thou keepest my name and hast not denied my faith, euen in those daies, whē Antipas my faithfull seruaunte was slaine among you, where Sathan dwelleth. But I haue a fewe Num. 24. 14. things against the, because thou hast thē there that maintaine the doctrine of Balam, which taught Balac to put a stumbling blocke before the children of Israell, that they shoulde eate of things sacrificed vnto Idols, and to commit fornication. Euen so▪ thou hast thē that maintaine the doctrin of Nicholaitans, which thing I ha • e.

It wil not be inough for you to haue bin constant. When Antipasles and faithful Martires were slaine: but you must also expell and driue from among you, the Baalamits, and supersticious, whiche put stumbling blocks before simple Israelit • , and cause many to eate of the sacrifice of Idolatrye. You must put from among you the Nicolaitans and vitious persons, which defile them selues with vice and
wic •• dnes.

The Sonne of God that hath eyesApo. 2. 18. like a sla •• of fire, and his féet like brasse (sayeth to the Churche of Thyatyra • :) I knowe thy works and thy loue and seruice, & faith, and thy patience, and thy deedes, and that they are more at the last, than at the first: notwithstanding I haue seene a thing against thee, that thou sufferest the woman Iesabell, which calleth hi • self a Prophetisse, to teach & deceiue my seruants, to make them to commit fornicatiō, & to eat meat sacrificed vnto idols.

The fiery eyes of Gods wisdome, and the brasen féete of his Iustice doo not only looke that you should increase and go forward in faith, in workes, and looue, and seruice and patience: but also to suppresse the woman Iesabel, the erronious church and people, which call themselues the catholick church, and yet which teache and deceiue Gods seruants, and plucke them from true religion, and cause them to sacrifice to the Idols, superstition and vanitie. But you will say, that I knowe that you be well▪ affected in religion, and well disposed in good works, and bent to continue • y the grace of God. And yet haue
you néede to watch and take héed th • the stock be so likewise.

A philosopher of your owne, saith, we be not borne to our selues only: but our Country claimeth part of vs, our parents claime part of vs, our fréends claime part The Candle doth not giue light to • t selfe, but Mat. 5. 15. 14. to those that be in the house. Ye be the light of the world. Salt doth not season it self but other meats. And you must shine to the worlde, you must season and profit your brethrē.

They be all partes of one mistical body,1. Cor. 12. 27. Eph. 4. 24. Gen. 1. 26. 1. Pet. 1. 19. 16, They be al citizens of one heauenlye Hierusalem. They be al framed after the glorious Image of the same eternal god. Al ransomed with the precious bloud of the same vnspotted Lamb Christ Iesus. All lightned and guilted, with the same holy spirit of God. You must euery one of you be Iosuahs, and sée that not only you:Iosu. 24 but al your houses and cities, and Countries, and people serue the Lord. Ioseph opened all places where store of CorneGen, 41. 16 was, and solde corne to al Egyptians. Ioseph must teach al, release al, and do Iustice to all.

Christ stood in the midst of his disciples
Christ biddeth his disciples to preach theIohn. 20. 19. Matth. 28. 19. Gospell to euerie creature. And you must stand in the midst of the disciples and people, and sée euerie one taught the gospell, and take héed to your selues, and to all the flocke of Christ. You shall be moued the rather to this carefulnesse, if you consider from whence you receiue this calling, not of your fréends, not of earthlie creatures, but from the holy Ghost. The holy Ghost hath made you Episcopos, ouerséers, ouerlookers, and watchmen ouer the flocke of Christ.

p.hi: There is no power but of God, and the powers
that be, are ordeined of God.

div.p:
I haue said you are Gods and the children Psal. 82. of the most highest. The Lord said vnto Moses. Behold, I haue made thee Pharaohs
Exod. 7. 1. God Thus saith Cirus king of Persia. Behold the Lord God of heauen hath giuen me
Esd. 1. 2. all the kingdomes of the earth. When God blessed his Church of Israel, he said thus:Esd. 49. 23. Kings shall bee thy fostering fathers, and Queenes thy nursing mothers: they shall worship with their faces towards the earth, and licke vp the dust of thy feete.

God hath giuen you power and authoritie,
God hath made you the children of the highest, and made you Gods of the world, and giuen you the kingdomes of the earth, and hath made you nursses of his people.
And marke well to what end. Neither to growe in riches, nor to liue in pleasure, nor to oppresse the weaker, but to féed the Church of God.

Open thy mouth for the dumb, in the cause prou. 31. 8. of all the children of destruction. Open thy mouth, iudge righteousnesse, and iudge the afflicted and poore. Good Iob saith: When the eare heard me, it blessed me, and when the Iob. 29. 11. eye sawe me, it gaue witnesse to me, for I deliuered the poore that cried, and the fatherlesse, and him that had none to helpe him. The blessing of him that was readie to perish came vpon me, and I caused the widdowes hart to reioyce. I put on Iustice and it couered me, my Iudgement was a Robe and a Crowne. I was the eyes to the blinde, and was feete to the lame, I was a father to the poore, and when I knew not the cause, I sought it out diligentlie. I brake also the iawes of the vnrighteous man, and pluckt the pray out of his teeth.

The Iudge should be law to the simple. The Noble, strength to the weake. The Minister, knowledge to the ignorant. The rich, meate and drinke to the hungrie. For rich men haue riches, not to spend epicuriously, but to reléeue those that néed. Learned men haue learning, to instruct the ignorant, and to féede Gods Church with the foode of knowledge. Wise men haue wisedome, not to circumuent or deceiue the simple, but to stand with the simple against the subtle. Great men haue power and authoritie, not to beate their fellow seruants, and to oppresse the weake, but to beare vp the weake against the oppressors, to féede the Church of Christ. Christ said vnto Peter, Iohn. 21. 15. feed my sheepe, feed my Lambs.

p.hi: Feed the flocke of Christ as much as lieth

in you, • aring for is, not by constraint, but willinglie, not for filthie lucre, but of a readie mind, not as though you were Lords ouer Gods inheritance, but that you may be examples to the flocke, and when the cheefe Shepherd shall appeare, you shall receyue an incorruptible crowne of glorie.
If the watchman▪ see the sword comming▪

and blowe the Trumpet, and warne the people: then he that heareth the sound of the Trumpet, and will not be warned, if the sword come and take him away, his bloud shall bee vpon his owne head. But if the watchman see the sword comming and take anie person from among them, he is taken awaie in his iniquitie, but his bloud God will require at the watchmans hand.

div.p: It lieth not in you to take sin from the people, and to make men religious and vertuous: but it lieth in you to blow the trumpets of Gods word, and to warne the people, that the sword of Gods wrath is comming, and tell them of their faults, and moue them to repentance. Paule planteth, Apollo watereth: but God 1. Cor. 3. 6. giueth the increase.

You should not eate the fat, and clothEze. 34. 3. your selues with the woll: but you should rather strengthen the weake, and heale the sicke, bind vp the broken, bring againe that which is driuen away, and séeke out that which is lost. And to the deafe so become eares, to the blind eies, tungs to the dumb, féet to the lame, and helps to the helplesse. Men héereafter
will giue you diuers names and titles, and call some of you Emperours, some kings, some Quéenes, some Dukes, some Earles, some Bishops, some Barons, Knights, Gentlemen, Lawyers, Merchants, some Ecclesiasticall, some ciuill: which names may not cause you to disdaine or neglect ech other, or contend one with another. But rather to draw in one line, remembring that though they be of seuerall callings, yet they be gifts all of one God, to moue you to take héed to your selues & to all the flocke of Christ ouer the which the holy Ghost hath made you ouerséers, to féed the Church of God.

For reckon of what price the Church of God is, and how déere it must néeds be vnto God, that was made againe, and bought againe with his owne blood. We are not ransomed with corruptible siluer and 1. Pet. 1. 19. gold, but with the precious blood of the vnspotted Lamb Christ Iesus.

God made man first a most gloriousGen. 1. 26. creature, an angell of light, full of truth and righteousnesse, but man made himselfe an ouglie féend of Hell, the child of Gods wrath and vengeaunce, a perpetuall
prisoner in the bottomlesse lake,Ephes. 2. 3. Matth. 13. 42. Mar. 9. 40. where there is wéeping and gnashing of teeth, where the worme of conscience neuer dieth, where the smoke of their torments goeth vp for euer and euer.

But Christ by his blood hath againe washed him from al his sinnes, and hathApo. 14. 11. made him frée from death, Hell, sin, andApo. 1. 5. Sathan, and brought him to fauour againe with God his father.

If the gold of Ophire, the precious stones and pearles of India, if all the treasures, and iewels, and vertues of heauen and earth, could haue made the price of our redemption, the sonne of God should neuer haue died. But our sinne was so great, the wrath of God so heauie, that nothing could satisfie both, but the death of the sonne of God. Great was the pain to be whipped, and scourged, and crowned with thornes, greater were the paines to be nailed to the crosse, and pearsed to the hart with a speare. But the paines that caused the sonne of God to sweate water and bloud, the paines that caused the sonne of God to crie out as it were doubtingly, O God my God why
hast thou forsaken me: could not all the creatures of heauen and earth, neither all the tungs of heauen and earth expresse. Much must it néeds be that made the sonne of God sorie, more that made the sonne of God lament, but that that caused him to vtter these as it were doubting words, O God my God, why hast thou forsaken me, can no hart conceiue. Surely, surely, euen then did he at one instant féele and beare the whole masse of Gods wrath, & the whole masse of paine & torment which all the elect of God shold for euer haue felt & borne, if he had not made thē againe with his bloud. Consider that nature bindeth you to loue your like, that God hath placed you in authority, & giuen you goodly gifts, & that to féede and help the people of God. Consider how great ye price of their redemption is, how déere they must néeds be vnto their God that bought them so deere, how straight an account he wil require of you for such precious treasures. And you shal sée that you haue good cause not to mispend one hour, but in taking héed to your selus, & the whole flock of Christ, wherof
the holy Ghost hath made you ouerséers, to féede them with Gods holy word and good discipline.

Moreouer, Sathan will thrust in among you rauening Wolues and professed enemies, which after they haue drawen you with hookes, whipped you with scourges, haled you with racks: will burne you to ashes, cast you into the sea, starue you to death, crucifie you with your héeles vpwards, teare you in péeces with wild horses, tie one of your féete to your head, and set you ouer a soft smokie fire vntill you be choked, cut off your eares, noses, lips, hands and féete, put sharp thornes vnder your nailes, boile you in leade, cast you to wilde beasts to be deuoured, or burie you quicke, or trie you with some such extreme torments.

Or else raise vp amongst you false brethren, pretending to be Gospellers, to be zealous in the word, to be good in life, as Montanists, Nouatians, Manichees, Pelagians, Nestorians, Arrians, and such Anabaptists and Libertines, which will bend and how the Scriptures to maintaine their monstrous errours. Some that
Christ is not the sonne of God, some that Christ is not man, some that Christ did not suffer, some that the bodies doo not rise againe, some condemning mariage, some taking away the benefit of repentaunce, some taking Magistrates of the common wealth, and making all alike, some blaspheming the Sacraments, some holding that whoredome is no sin, theft is no sin, murther no sin in them, and infinite such like, which they deuise and faine of their owne heads, puffed vp with vaine glorie to get themselues a name, and that the changeable people may flocke to their sermons, and their lectures, and their churches, and their discipline, drawne and fed with theyr fond nouelties, whereof the simple be too too desirous.

Though you shall be tried, not onely with the fell force of forraine foes, but also with the contentious, vaineglorious and dissembling brethren, yet may you not therefore shrinke, but looke vpon and follow the constancy of your forefathers.

Both the Wolues of Egypt, and professed enemies Amelech, Midian, Edom
and Moab did trouble Moses, and also the vaine-glorious dissembling Israelites, Corah, Dathan and Abiram, which rose vp against Moses and Aaron, and said vnto them. You take too much vpon you, seeing Num. 16. verse. 3. all the congregation is holy, euery one of them: and the Lord is amongst them. Wherfore then lift you vp your selues aboue the congregation? And some of you shall not only be troubled with superstitious Amelech, but much more with vaine glorious Dathan, who séeketh equalitie and communitie, alleaging that the congregation is holy euery one of thē, and that the Lord is among them, that they haue all the holy Ghost and the same spirit of God, that God is not tied to one more then another, and therfore neuer a one to be aboue other. Neither may thys bréede a doubt in your heads of true Religion, when you shall sée so many sects, schismes, and diuersities of opinions, euen amongst those that professe ye word: no more then when the good farmer hath sowed in his well tilled ground good wheate, he will condemne his wheate & his ground when he séeth wéeds growe
amongst it. You know ye great housholderMath. 13. verse. 30. did not only spy Tares growyng amongst his wheat sowed by the enuious man: but also gaue charge to suffer them to growe vntill the haruest.

Nay rather, assure your selues, that it is trueth and true Religion, because there be such Sects and diuersities of opinions. When the strong man armed keepeth Luc. 11. verse. 21. the house: the things that he possesseth are in quiet. So long as the strōg possessed the Churche: so long all slept togither in peace and quiet, and dreamed the same fancyes. For your enimie Sathan thatLuc. 22. verse. 31. sifteth you, is a subtle seruaunt, and knoweth too well what he hath to doe. He can playe the Fisher, whiche when he hath taken the Fish once sure in his nette: draweth it softlye, leaste hast shoulde braste the nette and let the fish goe. He can playe the Nurce, which when she hath rocked hyr Child asléepe, is quiet hir selfe, but if the Childe awaketh or cryeth, Then she rocketh and singeth as faste and as loude as she can. So Sathan, when he hath rocked and lulled his Children asléepe in
idolatrie and ignorance is quiet inough. But when the voice of God awaketh them out of that sléepe, then beginneth he to rocke and stir himselfe againe. You may be sure that then he hath most cause when you sée him most busie.

Neither can you haue a more certaine token of errour, then fleshlie concord. &c. Neither can you haue a more certaine token of Gods truth, then that you spie Sathan angrie, stirring debate, and sowing the tares of varietie of opinions. And what is it now adaies that can anger him, but the truth and the Gospell of Christ preached, against which he bendeth all his force and might, and vseth all meanes possible, though he cannot ouerthrow it, to deface it?

The seruant may not be in betterIoh. 13. 16 Luc. 2. 7. case then his maister. Your maister Christ was borne in a stable, wrapt in a few rags, and laied in the maunger of the Oxe and the Asse, for there was no roome for him in the Inne. Rich men may lodge in the Inne of this world, they may liue in honour, in ease and pleasure. But the good Christians must
liue in the stable, and must be swadled in the rags of reproch, contempt, and infamie. For hée that will not bée partaker with Christ in his rags of infamie, shall neuer be partaker with Christ in his robes of glorie, as himselfe saith. He that will be my Scholer, let him denie himselfe, Math. 16. verse. 24. take vp his crosse and follow me.

Meruaile not, if yée shall sée professors of errour rich, honoured; renowmed in this world. But those that preach and deliuer the most precious pearle the word of God, the key of our saluation, be contemned and despised, that euery lewde fellow may speake, and doo his pleasure to them, and be borne out by one Macheuile or other, for the world loueth their owne, but the children of God it doth hate. And the children of God can no more liue in the honour and renowme of this world, then sugar be preserued in vinagre, or salt in the sea.

But you will say, all these things trouble vs neuer a whit, for by Gods grace we are sufficientlie armed to stand against them all. But this only troubleth vs, that you Paule go from vs, and doo not
leaue vs, or promise vs to send vs another Paule, or doo not refer vs to some visible teacher, or Church, whose iudgement we may stand and trust to. For as you say so we knowe that Sathan auouched scripture, that the Libertines auouchedMath. 4. 6 Scriptures, that Antichrist will bring Scripture, the Arrians will bring Scripture. And an hundred kind of sectaries and hereticks, will bend and bowe the Scriptures to drawe men to theyr sort, and many of them will be men of great learning, wit and authoritie.

If Scripture be brought againste Scriptures, and learned men vrge them against learned men, whome shall the simple and vnlearned sort of vs trust t • , or to whome doo you refer vs? to neuer a else of you all, But I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to finish his building, and to giue you an inheritance amongst his blessed Saints.

When Christ with his naturall bodie was to leaue the world, and to depart from his disciples, they were sorie in the selfe same respect that you be, that they should want their faithfull visible guide
and head. Christ comforteth them, not telling that he would leaue either Peter, Paule, Iames or Iohn in his place, neyther with sending them to any visible teacher, or any visible Church. But by telling them that he would send the holyIohn. 14. verse. 16. Iohn. 16. verse. 13. Ghost, the spirit of truth to be their guide and • omforter, and his vicar generall in all truth.

So Paule departing from you, leaueth you & referreth you, neither to Titus, nor Timothe, nor to Barnabas, Silas, Marke, or Apollo, nor to the Church of Antioche, Ephesus, or Cor • nthus, nor to the Church of Hierusalem, Roome or Geneua, nor to any visible Church that hath béene from the beginning of the world▪ or shall be to the end of the world. But I commend you to God the holy Ghost, and the word of his grace and mercie, which hath builded you vpon the foundationEph. 2. 20. of the Apostles and Prophets, the rocke Christ Iesus the sonne of the liuing God. Therefore looke euer to this foundation which Christ layde, saying: Thou art Peter, that is, Rockie, and vpon Math. 16. verse. 18. this Rock which thou hast cōfessed, saying,
(thou art Christ the sonne of the liuing God) I will build my Church, and the gates of hell shall not preuaile against it.

This is the only immouable foundation:Hil. lib. 6. de Trin. this is the only happy rocke of faith confessed by the mouth of Peeter. Thou art the sonne of the liuing God, bearing so much the certaintie of truth, as peruerse questions and godlesse quarrels shall be moued. This faith is the foundation of theHil. lib. 6. de Trini. Church, by this faith the gates of hell are weake against it, this faith hath the keies of the kingdome of heauen.

He did not say vpon Peter, for he didChri. ser. de Pent. not build his Church vpon man, but vpon the faith and confession of Peter what was this faith and confession? Thou art Christ the sonne of the liuing God.

We that be and are called Christians,Aug. lib. 18. ca. 54. de ciuit. dei. beléeue not in Peter, but in him in whom Peter beléeued. Christ, the same maister of Peter which leadeth to life euerlasting, he is our maister.

This thing confessed by Peter, dothAmbr de incarnati domini cap. 5. not onlie abandon one heresie: but wheras the Church like a good ship is tossed with many waues of the sea, the same
must be the b •• against al heresies. A day would not suffice to recite the names of heretinks; and heresies. Yet against them al staudeth this faith, that Christe is the Sonne of God, both eternall from his father▪Irenaeus li. 2 ca. 59 and borne of the vil gilt.

To build vpon the scripture, which is the certain & vndoubted troth: is to 〈…〉 ild the house vpon the strong and sure rock. But to leane that and to build vpon any other kinde of doctrine whatsoeuer it be: is to 〈…〉 ild vpon the sinking sand.

If so be the conduit of water doe suddēlyCiprian. faile men go to the heade, that there they • ray learne the cause of the default. And so should the ministers of god do, following the commandements of god, that af •• ueth begin in any point to slacke: we should haue recourse vnto the originall of the lawe and the Gospell, and writings of the Apostles. That the triall of things may flowe from the • e, from whence the order and original doth spring. For the people of God is to be commended to god and to the grace of his word, which is able to finish the buildings.

If you had béene builded by man, or vponMat. 8. 26. the sand, the tempests and stormes of hell and the worlde might haue shaken you. But the foundation is Christe, the sonne of the liuing God. The woorkman is the holy Ghoste. And the woorde of his grace and mercy is the toole, and instrument. You saw the light of the law much dimmed after the death of Dauid, and other good kings, by the captiuities of Babilon, Caldaea and Assiria, and diuerse warres and contentions that followed.
But God sent his sonne to reere it vp again. You shal sée it much dimmed by the Romain Bishops: but God shall make it shine again the time appointed.

Doe you fast much, pray much, watche much read the scriptures much, and care not for all their Schismes and sects, stormes and persecutions, and diuersities of opinions. For God that begon to builde your soules for his tēples, will finish the woork, and wil reueal so much of ye truth of his word vnto you, as shall be sufficiēt for you.

The God that said vnto Abraham, Feare
not Abraham, I am thy buckler and thy exceeding great reward.
Gen. 15. 1.

The God that saide so Israel: Feare not, I haue redeemed thee, I haue called thee by thy Isa. 43. 1. name, thou art mine Whē thou passest through vvater I vvill be vvith thee, and through the f • ddes, that they doo not ouerflow thee. When thou walkest through the fire; thou shalt not be burnt? neither shall the flame kindle vppon thee. I am the Lord thy God, the holy one of Israell, thy sauiour. Isa. 44. 2.

The God that saith to Iacob: Feare not Iacob my seruant, and thou righteous, whome I haue chosen, for I will poure water vppon the thirstie, and fluds the dry ground. I will poure my spirit vpon thy seede, and my blessing vpon thy buds, and they shall growe as among the grasse, and as the willowes by the riuer of waters.

The same God saith vnto you that he is your buckler, that the water & waues of persecution shal not drowne you, neither the fire of dissentiō kindle vpō you▪ but ye thirsty shal drink of the flud of his word, and his spirit shall blesse the séeds & buds of al your words and déedes, & they shall growe and flourish in his Church.
And as you are required to reade GodsIoh. 5. 39. word diligently, and to trust to it faithfully: so be you to be admonished, not to bée too curious and too busy aboue your capacities. For God giueth faith and the spirit of knowledge by measure, To euery mā his peny and Ghomer, that is, inough,Eph. 4. 7. but not all alike.
Let no man presume to vnderstand aboue that which is méete to vnderstand,Rom. 13. 3 but that we vnderstand according to sobrietie, as God hath delt to euery man the measure of faith.
God hath giuen to one ten talents, to another fiue, to another one; some of youMa. 2 • . 15 may vnderstand much, some lesse▪ & some not so much.

Trueth it is, that the holy Ghost is not tied to the schoole dores, and much lesse to the lawyers pen, or the merchāts wares or the artificers shops, yet as God hath his among the lawyers, among the artificers, among the merchants, and among all sorts of men: so learning is a goodly instrument in the Church of God, and a necessary handmaid to the word of GOD
and religion of god. About ships we trust the sea mens iudgement, The Lawyers about points of lawe.

The Phisitions about medicines. And euery artificer about his worke. And let vs not thinke▪ but God blesseth their laboures and trauailes▪ which spēd al their daies and times in prayer and studye of good learning.

And as it is true that euery man may and ought to read or heare red, euery story, branch, sentence, and word of scripture diligētly and painfully: so it is most true that euery one should not take vpon him the vnderstānding and expoundyng of euery scripture & mistery of God and his word. For he which sawe Christ, and receiued the Gospel from Christ, doth cry out. O the deepenesse of the riches, both of the wisdome and knowledge of God. How vnsearchable 1. Cor. 9 1. Gal. 1. 12. Rom. 9. 33 are his iudgements, and his waies past finding out.

God shal furnish his Church with many good learned Fathers and Martirs, and yet god shal suffer them tō • aile and slide in one point or other. God shall suffer thē to slide. First that they might knowe thē
selues to be men. Secondlie that other may know them to be men & not Gods. Now if the pillers of the Church, which haue the ten Talentes, and as it were the fulnesse of Faith and spirit, shall not attaine to the perfect knowledge and vnderstanding of euery Scripture: much • lesse shall suche as haue but fiue talents, and least of all, suche as haue but one talent attaine the same.

So that Christians must become Bées which sit vpon euery flower, but neither doo take iuice out of euery flower, neither al the iuice out of such floures as they doo take some, but such and so much as shall suffice them to make Honye of. Euen so christians must sit on euery floure of the scripture, but neither take iuice out of euery flour, neither take al iuce out of such floures as they take some. But of suche floures, and so much as shall suffice euery one of them to make Hony according to their Talent, gift, and calling, to builde their part of the Church of God.

Princes and Counsailors which haue charge of euery one in the Realme, may not let Gods booke goe out of their sight,
but must vpon it day and night. For they haue cure of much people; & are to make much hony out of the floures of the word to féede them with.
Nobles, Bishops and Iudges, that haue great diocesses and iurisdictions, and circuits, must read much in Gods booke, for they néede much Hony to féed the people vnder them with.

Housholders must read so muche as wil serue them, their wiues, their Children, and al their seruants. For eache of them must be fed with so much hony out of Gods word, as wil teach them to feare God, obey their prince, loue theyr neighboure, and doo their dutie to their maister and other superiours. Neyther woulde God haue vs know al things in this life:1. Cor. 13. 2 for we know in part, and prophesie in part.

Let vs neuer require a reason of Gods doing, although many of them doe greatlyChris. ad Rom. ca 1 trouble vs. Only God is to command, the seruants must obey This is the peculiar gift of faith, although we know not the manner of Gods purpose▪ yet to imbrace the maiestie of his prouidence.

Wee may not reprooue any thing in scripture which we doe not vnderstand:
for there are many things that are not toAmbr. li. de paradiso. ca. 2. be measured by our capacitie: but by the déepenes of Gods purpose and word, It is better to be ignorant than to erre: but to vnderstand is better than to be ignorant.Aug. sup. Ioh tract 21. Therefore we ought to doo our best and vtmost to knowe if we can, the graces and goodnesses of God. And yet if we cannot knowe the trueth, let vs not fall into errour.

As oft as you searche the mysteries of God, and shall find any doubte, haue aIustinus liber de trinitate. redy solution for al douts and questions. I meane faith, remembring that when god shal do the déed, although something be vnknown, either for the excellencye of nature, or for the manner of the prouidence, they that be ignoraunt shall take no hurt. Be religious and suppresse your doubts, neither let any thing satisfie▪ our doubts but only Faith. Be same, Gods word is true, although you doe not sée how.

And if there happen any Scripture that seeme darke, or contrary to the common course of beléefe and Faith: let them with the blessed Virgine Mary, laye the
same vp in their harts, and suspends their Iudgemēt, and think that it is either notLuc. 2. 19. néedfull for them to knowe any more, or els though God hath not yet, he wyll in time reuele vnto them the trueth.

Some shal fal into distrust, and some into moste vaine fantasies vpon this presumption, that they must, may and do vnderstand and truely expound euery place of scripture, aswell as the best learned man in the world: when as it were much more better for thē to suspend their iudgements vntil god did open it, and yet euer to ancor vpon God, and the word of his grace, which is able and without per aduenture will finish the building of hys Church and people in this world, and in the next world giue them an inheritance amongst all his blessed saints in euerlasting blesse and ioye. Otherwise if they wil be caried awaye with a Spirituall pride: they will run into infinite errors.

God be mercifull vnto vs, and blesse vs, & Psal. 67. 1. shew vs the light of his countenance and bee mercifull vnto vs, and graunt vs that the regard of our selues helth, may mooue vs to take héede to our selues, and the lawe
to take héede to our neighboures, and the holy Ghost to both, to that end and purpose, that as God hath indued euery one of yo with many goodly giftes, & placed you in diuers kind of authorities: so may you féede and reléeue Gods people according to your talent, lest that the soules of christian men, the most pretious treasure made again with the blood of the lamb of God should perish by your default.

And that such troubles as haue béene, or be, or may be, either from the rauening woolus, or crooked sectaries, may be spurs to quicken you to be carefull & watchfull ouer your charge. And that you euer trust in God and his worde whiche is a strong buckler against all perils, and a sufficiēt warrāt to haue good successe, to finish the building of the church of god here in this worlde, and in the next world to inherit the kingdome of heauen, with al ye blessed Saints of God, the Father, the Sonne and the holy Ghost: to whom be al praise, & honor and glory, nowe and euermore. Amen.
